greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, of the coefficients of [x^k] in G100234(x)^n such that the row sums are 6^n-1 for n>0, where G100234(x) is the g.f. of A100234.
comment: The main diagonal forms A100236. Secondary diagonal is: T(n+1,n) = (n+1)*A100237(n). More generally, if g.f. F(x) satisfies: m^n-b^n = Sum_{k=0..n} [x^k]F(x)^n, then F(x) also satisfies: (m+z)^n - (b+z)^n + z^n = Sum_{k=0..n} [x^k](F(x)+z*x)^n for all z and F(x)=(1+(m-1)*x+sqrt(1+2*(m-2*b-1)*x+(m^2-2*m+4*b+1)*x^2))/2; the triangle formed from powers of F(x) will have the g.f.: G(x,y)=(1-2*x*y+m*x^2*y^2)/((1-x*y)*(1-(m-1)*x*y-x^2*y^2-x*(1-x*y))).
example: where row sums form 6^n-1 for n>0:
mathematica: row[n_] := CoefficientList[ Series[ (1 + 5*x + Sqrt[1 + 6*x + 29*x^2])^n/2^n, {x, 0, n}], x]; Flatten[ Table[ row[n], {n, 0, 9}]](* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 11 2012, after PARI *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 29 2004
